playn.core

Interface Touch

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TouchImpl, TouchStub

    public interface Touch
    Input-device interface for touch and multi-touch events if they are supported.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Touch.Adapter
      A Touch.Listener implementation with NOOP stubs provided for each method.
      static interface  Touch.Event
      An event dispatched to report touch information.
      static class  Touch.LayerAdapter
      A Touch.LayerListener implementation with NOOP stubs provided for each method.
      static interface  Touch.LayerListener
      An interface for listening to touch events that interact with a single layer.
      static interface  Touch.Listener
      An interface for listening to all touch events.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancelLayerTouches(Layer except)
      Cancels all currently active touch interactions on layers.
      boolean hasTouch()
      Returns true if the underlying platform supports touch interaction.
      boolean isEnabled()
      Returns true if touch interaction is enabled, false if not.
      Touch.Listener listener()
      Returns the currently configured global touch listener, or null.
      void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Allows touch interaction to be temporarily disabled.
      void setListener(Touch.Listener listener)
      Sets the listener that will receive touch events.

    • Method Detail

      • hasTouch

        boolean hasTouch()
        Returns true if the underlying platform supports touch interaction. If this method returns false, listeners may still be registered with this service but they will never be notified.

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Returns true if touch interaction is enabled, false if not. Interaction is enabled by default. See setEnabled(boolean).

      • setEnabled

        void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Allows touch interaction to be temporarily disabled. No touch events will be dispatched whilst this big switch is in the off position.

      • listener

        Touch.Listener listener()
        Returns the currently configured global touch listener, or null.

      • setListener

        void setListener(Touch.Listener listener)
        Sets the listener that will receive touch events. Setting the listener to null will cause touch events to stop being fired.

      • cancelLayerTouches

        void cancelLayerTouches(Layer except)
        Cancels all currently active touch interactions on layers. This does not cancel any touch interactions being managed by the global touch listener. This is useful if you are implementing "overlapping" interactions, like the ability to click on buttons and also the ability to flick scroll an entire interface. You might start an interaction by clicking a button, but then turn that interaction into a flick scroll by flicking your finger. Your code should then cancel the button interaction so that the user does not accidentally end up clicking the button if they happen to move finger in just the right way.
        Parameters:
        except - a layer to be exempted from the cancelation (this would be the layer that "wins" in the conflict of who gets to process the event sequence), or null.
